block.p: Hilary Ann Magowan, a daughter of Jill Oriane Tarlau of New York and Peter Alden Magowan of San Francisco, was married on Friday evening to Anton Malko, a son of Elizabeth Sutherland Malko and George Malko of New York. The Rev. Dr. Melvin Hawthorne, an ecumenical minister, officiated at the Boathouse in Central Park.

Mrs. Malko, 28, coordinates exhibitions and appraisals at Sebastian Izzard Asian Art in New York. She and the bridegroom graduated from Connecticut College, although they did not become friends until later. She is a candidate for a master's degree in humanities at New York University. Her mother is a bookbinder. Her father, a former chairman and chief executive of Safeway, the supermarket chain, is president and managing general partner of the San Francisco Giants baseball team. The bride is the stepdaughter of Deborah Magowan.

Hilary Ann Magowan, a daughter of Jill Oriane Tarlau of New York and Peter Alden Magowan of San Francisco, was married on Friday evening to Anton Malko, a son of Elizabeth Sutherland Malko and George Malko of New York. The Rev. Dr. Melvin Hawthorne, an ecumenical minister, officiated at the Boathouse in Central Park.

Mrs. Malko, 28, coordinates exhibitions and appraisals at Sebastian Izzard Asian Art in New York. She and the bridegroom graduated from Connecticut College, although they did not become friends until later. She is a candidate for a master's degree in humanities at New York University. Her mother is a bookbinder. Her father, a former chairman and chief executive of Safeway, the supermarket chain, is president and managing general partner of the San Francisco Giants baseball team. The bride is the stepdaughter of Deborah Magowan.

Mr. Malko, 30, is the content manager in New York for Review.com, a subsidiary of the Princeton Review, a book publishing and test preparation company. His mother is a graphic designer. His father, a screenwriter, worked on the films ''Luna'' and ''Dogs of War''; he is also a playwright and an adjunct professor of advanced screenwriting at the Tisch School of the Arts at N.Y.U.
